noun.description: A game in which small balls are hit and then allowed to roll down a sloping board on which there are holes, each numbered with the score achieved if a ball goes into it, with pins acting as obstructions.
A thing of little importance; a very easy task.
examples: dealing with these boats was a mere bagatelle for the world's oldest yacht club

noun.description: A short, light piece of music, especially one for the piano.

origin: Mid 17th century (in bagatelle (sense 2)): from French, from Italian bagatella, perhaps from baga baggage or from a diminutive of Latin baca berry. bagatelle (sense 1) dates from the early 19th century.
